item.title: Tesla: Model X and S production on track, investing heavily in Model 3
item.description:
Tesla: Model X and S production on track, investing heavily in Model 3

Tesla's earnings for the second quarter of 2016 are out, and the company looks to be assuring investors that things are on track, both for the existing Model S and Model X cars and the upcoming Model 3. Tesla says it has completed the design of the Model 3 and that it has moved on to tooling, production planning, and validation.

item.title: Apple says all US employees now receive equal pay for equal work
item.description:
Apple says all US employees now receive equal pay for equal work

Today, Apple released updated diversity figures indicating it has made slight but steady progress in hiring more women and underrepresented minorities - and ensuring those employees are paid the same as their white male counterparts.

item.title: Tiny rocket company aims for 100 launches a year-and it just might succeed
item.description:
Tiny rocket company aims for 100 launches a year-and it just might succeed

Alone in the Mojave desert, the tiny rocket stood barely as tall as a basketball goal backboard. Launch control was a laptop inside a nearby bunker, and the small gathering of aerospace engineers and investors seemed almost like a rocket hobby club as they watched the vehicle soar to about 5,000 feet before parachuting back to Earth.

item.title: Is Elon Musk serious about the Tesla Semi?
item.description:
Is Elon Musk serious about the Tesla Semi?

Out of all of Elon Musk's recent "Master Plan Part Deux," the part that really caught our eye was a short paragraph about a Tesla semi. Much of the rest-solar, autonomous driving, ride-sharing-wasn't exactly unforeseen. But the idea of a heavy duty Tesla electric vehicle took us by surprise and left us scratching our heads.

item.title: Meet Moxie Marlinspike, the Anarchist Bringing Encryption to All of Us
item.description:
Meet Moxie Marlinspike, the Anarchist Bringing Encryption to All of Us

On the first day of the sprawling RSA security industry conference in San Francisco, a giant screen covering the wall of the Moscone Center's cavernous lobby cycles through the names and headshots of keynote speakers: steely-eyed National Security Agency director Michael Rogers in a crisp military uniform; bearded and besuited Whitfield Diffie and Ron Rivest, legendary inventors of seminal encryption protocols that made the Internet safe for communication and commerce.

item.title: There are limits to 2FA and it can be near-crippling to your digital life
item.description:
There are limits to 2FA and it can be near-crippling to your digital life

This piece first appeared on Medium and is republished here with the permission of the author. It reveals a limitation in the way Apple approaches 2FA, which is most likely a deliberate decision. Apple engineers probably recognize that someone who loses their phone won't be able to wipe data if 2FA is enforced, and this story is a good reminder of the pitfalls.

item.title: Tesla Gigafactory launch event tonight will be streamed online
item.description:
Tesla Gigafactory launch event tonight will be streamed online

Tesla will stream its Gigafactory launch party on its website, according to a tweet from Tesla CEO Elon Musk. The party, for Tesla vehicle owners who referred five other buyers as well as VIP guests, follows a press preview earlier this week that The Verge attended.

item.title: Mercedes pulls TV ad over potentially misleading automated driving claims
item.description:
Mercedes pulls TV ad over potentially misleading automated driving claims

Mercedes has discontinued a television ad for its new E-Class sedan. It comes after criticism from a number of consumer groups over a comparison the company made between its autonomous F 015 concept car and the advanced driver-assist systems in the E-Class.

item.title: The Hacker's Guide to High Performance Hustling Part 1/2
item.description:
The Hacker's Guide to High Performance Hustling Part 1/2

Now, I have always tried my best, and really punished myself for slacking off and not rocking at what I do. But this mostly consisted of getting awesome grades through university and being the best at the video game I was currently playing at the time (If you are interested, I was challenger [rank 3 at my peak] in league of legends, and was Masters in StarCraft).

item.title: First Look - Test Flight of Star Trek's U.S.S. Discovery
item.description:
First Look - Test Flight of Star Trek's U.S.S. Discovery

Revealed at Comic-Con 2016 by Executive Producer Bryan Fuller. Get a sneak peek of the newest ship in the "Star Trek" universe. Star Trek: Discovery premieres January 2017 on the CBS Television Network with the premiere and all subsequent episodes available exclusively on CBS All Access.
